fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The latest version of _atlassian-ical4j_'s method {{getCachedOnset}} is susceptible to trigger race condition, in which may lead to high CPU usage in Confluence.

(i) Team Calendar make use of _atlassian-ical4j_ library to support the implementation of timezones in an iCalendar format.
In this case, the race condition was observed specifically when the library was trying to determine whether the retrieved Calendar events' time is in daylight savings time. 

h3. Evidence in Thread Dumps
Example thread:
{code}
"http-nio-18009-exec-62" #736 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f835806e000 nid=0x18a7 runnable [0x00007f81df9d0000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.component.Observance.getCachedOnset(Observance.java:308)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.component.Observance.getLatestOnset(Observance.java:192)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.component.VTimeZone.getApplicableObservance(VTimeZone.java:313)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.TimeZone.inDaylightTime(TimeZone.java:120)
	at java.util.TimeZone.getOffset(TimeZone.java:209)
	at java.util.GregorianCalendar.computeFields(GregorianCalendar.java:2342)
	at java.util.GregorianCalendar.computeFields(GregorianCalendar.java:2312)
	at java.util.Calendar.setTimeInMillis(Calendar.java:1804)

	at java.util.Calendar.createCalendar(Calendar.java:1666)
	at java.util.Calendar.getInstance(Calendar.java:1627)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.CalendarDateFormatFactory$DateFormat.format(CalendarDateFormatFactory.java:298)
	at java.text.DateFormat.format(DateFormat.java:345)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Iso8601.toString(Iso8601.java:131)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.DateTime.toString(DateTime.java:433)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.util.Strings.valueOf(Strings.java:249)

	at java.lang.String.valueOf(String.java:2994)

	- locked <0x00007f877ebcb5a8> (a java.lang.StringBuffer)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Mail is disabled when {{-Datlassian.mail.senddisable=true}} is added in JVM argument, but administrator cannot know it from UI easily. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a warning as Jira does in a mail configuration page.
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-27 at 18.17.36.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround 
Go to [System Information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/viewing-system-information-150499.html] and check if  {{-Datlassian.mail.senddisable=true}} is configured in JVM argument.
fields.summary: Admin UI should warn when mail disabled by JVM argument atlassian.mail.senddisabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The description of "Execution behavior" for the following jobs in the document "[Scheduled Jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html]" is incorrect.
 * JournalCleaner
 * MailQueueFlushJob

h3. Suggested Solution
||Job Id||Execution Behavior(Wrong)||Execution Behavior(Correct)||
|JournalCleaner|Once per node|Once per cluster|
|MailQueueFlushJob|Once per cluster|Once per node|
fields.summary: Incorrect "Execution behavior" described in document "Scheduled Jobs"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Administrator cannot know the "per cluster" [scheduled jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html] are executed at which node in Data Center. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add an option to configure primary node to execute "per cluster" jobs.

h3. Why this is important
* Because the log of scheduled job execution will be dispersed to all nodes without primary-secondary configuration. 
* To prevent the "Clean Journal Entries" job to recreate index snapshot on a node that has broken index. ([Administer your Data Center search index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administer-your-data-center-search-index-879956107.html])


h3. Workaround 
Login to the expected node and run the scheduled job manually.
fields.summary: Let primary node execute "per cluster" scheduled jobs keeping other nodes standby on DC

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
If a calendar has edit restriction applied to it, an unrestricted user will not be able to see the "Subscribe" button.

h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a test calendar with no restrictions
# Create two test user (user1, user2)
# Both users are able to see the "Subscribe" button on the top right-hand corner (next to the "Add Event" button)
# Apply edit restriction to only user1
# Log in as user2 and check if the button is still present

user1 will see:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-25 at 8.08.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

user2 will see:
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-25 at 8.09.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround
The 'subscribe' button can still be found in the options (...) drop-down list
fields.summary: Subscribe Calendar button is missing if restriction is applied

fields.description: We know Confluence usage stats add-ons cause the performance issue in the system, and in the new Confluence versions, some customers still using it. Could we completely remove the add-on in the new version?
fields.summary: Completely remove the Confluence usage stats add-ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23006].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
With the small size of thumbnails, when there's only one single thumbnail image in the middle of text on a page, it's often hard to tell it's an image. And the visual presentation is somewhat strange. 

*What we do currently:*
Add the text 'click to enlarge' manually as part of an image title as shown in the screen capture.

*Improvements:*
* Thumbnails are displayed with a magnifier on top automatically. 
* One step further: Users can view the original image by hovering the mouse over thumbnails after a certain amount of time, say 0.5 or 1 sec, instead of having to click them.
fields.summary: Thumbnails should display "Click to enlarge" or a magnifier icon on top of images automatically

fields.description: We use the code block macro to show example configuration file contents. But regardless of the syntax used (even no syntax), "x.y", for example, is auto-formatted to a URL. When text is auto-converted to a link outside the macro, you can mouse over the link and click unlink. It would be great to have this functionality in the code block macro. Our users will often copy and paste content but accidentally click a non-existent link.
fields.summary: Ability to unlink in the code block macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to [Modify Confluence Interface Text|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/modify-confluence-interface-text-197745.html], you should be able to modify certain textual elements in the UI by updating the ConfluenceActionSupport.properties file contained in the confluence-x.x.x.jar file.  However, this doesn't appear to work now.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.10.0
 * Confluence 6.6.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce this problem:
 # Follow the steps listed under the "*Steps For Modification*" section of [Modify Confluence Interface Text|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/modify-confluence-interface-text-197745.html].
 # Modify a given property using guidance from the above page.

h3. Expected Results

You should see the UI change based on the modified property.
h3. Actual Results

There are no changes to the UI.
h3. Notes

Through testing, the feature appears to have been broken in a release between version 6.6.0 and 6.10.0.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Customization of Confluence Interface Text Broken

fields.description:
h3. Environment
- This is found on any Confluence version with the PDF exporter bundled plugin running at version 5 or later.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Specify the following path in {{confluence.cfg.xml}}:
{code}
<property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">/confluence-home/temp</property>
{code}
# Start (or restart) Confluence to accept changes
# Generate a PDF export

h3. Expected Results
- On completion of a PDF export the file will download and you will be able to continue working on the page you exported from. URI path looks like this:
{code}
.../download/temp/pdfexport-20181213-131218-0451-23/
{code}

h3. Actual Results
- On completion of a PDF export the file will be available in the specified temp directory, but in the UI you will be brought to a friendly Confluence 404 page ("Page Not Found". URI path looks like this:
{code}
.../download/_*confluence-home*_/temp/pdfexport-20181207-071218-2049-5/
{code}

h3. Notes

This came about while researching PDF exporter issues and was exposed as a new bug in the 5.0 addon branch.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround other than changing the setting to point to its default location or somewhere else in the Confluence home path.
fields.summary: Specifying directory outside of <confluence-home> for webwork.multipart.saveDir in confluence.cfg.xml causes PDF export to show "Page Not Found" error in UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* If you try to subscribe to a JustWorks iCal URL, the following error is thrown and you can't subscribe to it:

{code}
Error(s) occurred.

Unable to load events of <Calendar Name> (<Calendar ID>): calendar3.error.loadevents.notexist
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# In a Team Calendar, click on *... >> Subscribe by URL*
# Enter the calendar's name, the JustWorks iCal URL and the related space
# Click on the *Subscribe* button

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* If a user is watching the space where a Team Calendar is in and an event is created/edited in it, the user won't be notified about these changes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a calendar
# Have _userA_ to be a watcher of the space where this calendar is at
# Have _userB_ to add an event or edit it without adding _userA_ in the event
# Save the changes

h3. Expected Results  

* The watchers will receive a notification of the changes made to the calendar's events.

h3. Actual Results 

* No notification is sent. In the logs, the following error is seen:
{code}
2018-12-21 15:04:46,837 WARN [http-nio-26120-exec-10] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date null time 8:00 AM
 -- referer: http://localhost:26120/c6120/display/CS/calendars | url: /c6120/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: c76d11bbb790c94f | userName: renata
{code}  

h3. Notes 

* This seems to be related to [CONFSERVER-54550|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54550].

h3.Workaround 

* _userA_ will have to stop watching the space and start watching the calendar to receive the event change's notifications.
fields.summary: Team Calendars doesn't send notifications to space watchers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence allows users to access the _view mode_ of a shared draft as a regular page.
As shared drafts should be accessible by the user only when _editing_ a page, exposing it from the _view mode_ may create inconsistencies in the database, such as when a user clicks on the _like_ button when viewing a draft.
When such inconsistence is created, it can then lead to other problems, such as preventing _Collaborative Editing_ from being enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a fresh installation of Confluence.
# Create a new page and publish it.
# Edit this page and save a draft without publishing it.
 #* At this point you a have a published version + a draft with _unpublished changes_.

(...)

h3. Expected Results
A shared draft should not be exposed to the user on the same way as a regular page.
When {{<Confluence Base URL>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<draftId>}} URL is accessed, it should retrieve a 404 response page, even when the draft exists in the database.
Confluence REST API protects the user from this bug, providing a 404 message when trying to access the draft using the {{/rest/api/content}} method.
 !confserver57697_img003.png|thumbnail! 

When Collaborative Editing is enabled and the [{{removeStaleSharedDrafts}}|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.2.0/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/PageManager.html#removeStaleSharedDrafts--] method is executed, it should consider the {{likes}} table -- and any other with a constraint related to the {{content}} table.

h3. Actual Results
A shared draft can be viewed through {{<Confluence Base URL>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<draftId>}} URL.
Then a user can _like_ the draft, what may create a problem if CE is turned off and on.

h3. Workaround
When enabling Collaborative Editing after a long time with it disabled, consider [manually removing stale drafts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-manually-remove-stale-drafts-from-confluence-database-951392345.html].
fields.summary: Confluence shared drafts are exposed as a regular page using the viewpage.action

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If Confluence has been integrated with a Jira instance and also contains gadgets on pages, Confluence performance can degrade if Jira has an outage or performance issue. This is due to how Confluence currently stores and fetches gadget data from Jira.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence
 * Jira
 * Confluence Gadgets

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Confluence & Jira
 # Set up some Jira Gadgets in Confluence
 # Make Jira unresponsive to Confluence
 # Visit a page with a Jira gadget on it

h3. Expected Results
 # Confluence may not render the gadget (because Jira is unresponsive) but performance across the instance will remain stable

h3. Actual Results
 # Confluence threads can get stuck in a RUNNABLE state attempting to read gadget data from Jira. This has the unfortunate affect of bottlenecking other HTTP threads as those threads take forever to process and can cause a performance issue.

h3. Workaround

Unknown
h3. Diagnosis:

You may see just a few long running *{{RUNNABLE}}* threads with other threads stacking up behind these threads causing a bottleneck.
{code:java}
 171 threaddump-node6/sync_threads.1544641605.txt-   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
  14 threaddump-node6/sync_threads.1544641605.txt-   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
{code}
From *{{RUNNABLE}}* threads, you may see some like the following:
{code:java}
"http-nio-8090-exec-4766" #210557 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fefbc25e800 nid=0xf080 runnable [0x00007fee4066e000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
...
	at org.apache.shindig.gadgets.DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.getGadgetSpec(DefaultGadgetSpecFactory.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.local.LocalGadgetSpecFactory.getGadgetSpec(LocalGadgetSpecFactory.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.local.LocalGadgetSpecFactory.getGadgetSpec(LocalGadgetSpecFactory.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.getGadgetSpec(GadgetSpecFactoryImpl.java:79)
...
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetMacro.getViewType(GadgetMacro.java:460)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetMacro.getGadgetView(GadgetMacro.java:436)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetMacro.generateMacroDiv(GadgetMacro.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetMacro.renderGadget(GadgetMacro.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.GadgetMacro.execute(GadgetMacro.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller.executeMacro(ViewMacroMarshaller.java:273)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.ViewPageAction.execute(ViewPageAction.java:270)
{code}
Or Stuck Threads:
{code:java}
[ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Catalina]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDetected Thread "ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-412 url:/plugins/macrob...owse-macros.action" (id=xxx) has been active for 60,733 milliseconds (since 4/22/20 9:29 AM) to serve the same request for https://test/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action?detailed=false&macroMetadataClientCacheKey=1587562106899 and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is 60 seconds). There is/are 252 thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
 java.lang.Throwable
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.Mutex.acquire(Mutex.java:45)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:103)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderImpl.<init>(GadgetFeedReaderImpl.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.getFeedReader(GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.java:28)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor949.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)

	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:208)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2053.getFeedReader(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.metadata.GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.getUrisFromFeedStore(GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.java:243) {code}
(!) Fetching gadget spec doesn't currently have a timeout threshold which explains why these threads can get stuck in a running state.

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* If you have an event which repeats daily and has a reminder and you remove one instance of it of your calendar, you'll still receive the email notification reminding of the deleted event.

h3. Environment 
* Windows 7
* Team Calendar 6.0.25

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# In a calendar, create an event that is repeating daily and it has a reminder one hour before the event starts. 
# Save the event. 
# In the calendar UI, navigate to and click on a future occurrence of this event, choose "delete – This instance only".

h3. Expected Results  

* The deleted event won't trigger any reminder notification.

h3. Actual Results 

* The deleted event triggers an email notification reminding of its occurrence (even though it is deleted from the UI).

h3. Notes 
* On the images 1 and 3, it is shown the calendars with its events and the deleted occurrences.

 !1.png|thumbnail! 

 !3.png|thumbnail! 

* On the images 2 and 4, it is shown the notifications received even though some of the events were already deleted.

 !2.png|thumbnail! 

 !4.png|thumbnail! 

* On the images 5 and 6, it is shown that the deleted events have been excluded from the calendar (EXDATE field); the image 7 complements these two, showing that the events *35* and *36* are related to the *Test number 5* and *Test number 6* events.

 !5.png|thumbnail! 

 !6.png|thumbnail! 

 !7.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Team Calendars sending notifications for deleted events

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate the issue*
# Download and Install the Russian Language Pack JAR file from [Atlassian Translation|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven/com/atlassian/translations/confluence-language-pack-ru_RU/]
(i) Choose *6.12.0.rc1-20180927063854*.
# Go to the *Profile Settings* in Confluence
# Click the *Edit* button, change Language to "русский (Россия)" and *Save* the changes.
# Access any Confluence page.
# Click on the *Share* option to share the page.
# Add your username into *Add people* field, then click *Share*.

*Expected behaviour*
You'll receive a Workbox notification in Russian Language.

*Actual Behaviour*
You receive a Workbox notification in a broken character:
!brokenchars.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Broken character in Confluence Workbox Notification using Russian Language

fields.description:
Prior to Confluence 6.11.0, users were able to edit Office documents in their iOS devices if they access the Desktop version of the site from their browsers. 

This however is not possible since the introduction of the Companion App for editing files. Please consider creating a Companion App for iOS.
fields.summary: Add Companion App support for iOS

h3. Summary
On Confluence server 6.12.2 requesting wrong REST URL /rest/cql/contenttypes?category=test we will see full stack-trace.

The same we can see at https://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/cql/contenttypes?category=test

On production, a regular user should not see the stack-trace when an error happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an incorrect REST URL

h3. Expected Results
An error message without stack-trace

h3. Actual Results
An error message with stack-trace
{code}
<status>
<status-code>500</status-code>
<message>Unrecognised type category : test</message>
<stack-trace>
com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: Unrecognised type category : test at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.cql.rest.CQLMetaDataResource.contentTypes(CQLMetaDataResource.java:73) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)

{code}

fields.description:
Moving a selection of cells to a different position is two mouse clicks in Google Tables/Docs or Excel. In Confluence, this is not possible. Adding or removing rows or columns to achieve the same goal is not helping, as it will affect other content. People often resort to copying the table in another application, making the needed changes there, and copying it back to Confluence (...and then adding the lost formatting).

Please consider adding this functionality - thank you.
fields.summary: Table editing functionality

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When linking to another page in the same PDF export, a plain link with a URL in the format "/confluence/ds/MyPage" will be converted to an anchor link that will go to that location in the PDF (which is expected). However, if the link contains an anchor link such as "/confluence/ds/MyPage#MyPage-MyAnchor" then the link will not be converted and instead, it will link to the actual confluence instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create PageOne
# Add an anchor in PageOne called MyAnchor
# Create PageTwo in the same space
# Add a link to PageOne#MyAnchor
# Export Space (Space tools > Content Tools > Export > PDF)
# Check the exported PDF and click the link in PageTwo

h3. Expected Results
Link within pdf file

h3. Actual Results
Link to confluence instance
fields.summary: PDF export: Links are only converted to "in-file" links if they do not contain a hashtag

fields.description: h3. Summary When using a newly created page, inserting a Jira issue via URL does not convert issue to a Jira Issue Macro, but turns the link into a HTML link instead. h3. Environment * Confluence Server on Windows or Linux * Confluence with Application Link to Jira (with or without impersonation) * Relevant Jira version with sample project as documented in  [Application links version matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/applinks/application-links-version-matrix-779174762.html] * Confirm macros are activated as documented in ** [JIRA links fail to auto-convert to JIRA macros in Confluence editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/jira-links-fail-to-auto-convert-to-jira-macros-in-confluence-editor-800862617.html] h3. Steps to Reproduce # Click Create in Confluence to create a new page # Copy a URL of an issue from Jira and paste directly into the Confluence editor h3. Expected Results The link is converted into a Jira Issue Macro. h3. Actual Results The link is converted into a HTML link. h3. Notes When you paste a Jira link like * [http://mycompany.com/jira/browse/TIC-1] The editor makes a POST request to Confluence with URL of * [http://mycompany.com/confluence/rest/tinymce/1/macro/placeholder] and payload of {code:java} {"macro":{"name":"jira","params":{"server":"JIRA 7.6.9","serverId":"64808c20-cf07-31b2-954c-3693eafd1183","key":"TIC-1"}},"contentId":"1212417"} {code} the return from the POST request is the grey image box which represents the Jira Issue Macro {code:java} {code} The original POST request is not being sent on newly created pages. h3. Workaround Save the page, and re-edit it before adding Jira issues. Newly added Jira issue URLs are converted.
fields.summary: Jira issues are not converted to macros when adding to a new page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current Space Administrators are free to add the [Space Admin permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html] to any user or group, without any configurable limit on the number of space administrators.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Confluence administrator, I would like to globally limit the number of space administrators on each Space.
When a Space admin is adding the space admin permission to new users or groups and if that limit is surpassed, then the admin would receive a friendly notification saying no more admins could be added due to the limit.
This functionality must be able to check the number of users under a group (consider nested groups as well).

h3. Why this is important
Limiting the maximum number of space administrators on all spaces would help to avoid current administrators adding large security groups, without knowing who's part of that group.
As Uncle Ben said, _with great power comes great responsibility_; and great is the power assigned to a Space administrator, even being able to delete the full space.
Limiting the number of space admins by space is a way to safeguard content, insuring this permissions is wisely assigned.
 
h3. Workaround
Periodically review the administrators of each space and perform manual _curation_ of space admins.
The following KB articles may help the Confluence administrator to determine the users and groups with Space admin permissions:
 * [How do I view a list of all space administrators for all spaces|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-i-view-a-list-of-all-space-administrators-for-all-spaces-346325879.html]
 * [How to list which spaces a group can access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-list-which-spaces-a-group-can-access-720636535.html]
 * [How to Check Permissions for a Space via SQL Queries|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-check-permissions-for-a-space-via-sql-queries-717062216.html]
fields.summary: Ability to configure a limit on the number of Space Administrators by Space on Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Background
CWD-3484 underlined a misleading wording that was displayed as password reset message. While it apparently has been fixed for Crowd, it is still an issue in Confluence:

{quote}
The message that is displayed can be very misleading as it always informs users that an email was sent even though this is not always true. If there are no plans to make the message conditional, it would certainly make sense to at least change the wording of the generic message. Perhaps something like the following would be more appropriate:
"Thank you. If we find an account matching the username you have entered you will receive an email with further instructions and a reset password link. The link will lead to a page where you can choose your new password."
{quote}
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Go to the login page and click on _Forgot your password?_
# Type in any string as username which is either existing or not
# The following misleading message is displayed:
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

As pointed out in CWD-2457, not revealing whether or not the user exists in the DB is a cautious design decision, which is fine.

h4. Suggestion

However, in line with CWD-3484, a more generic wording should be used in Confluence as well:
{quote}
Thanks! If we recognize that email address, you should receive a link to reset your password via email soon. If you don't receive an email in the next five minutes, check your spam folder or try again with a different email address.
{quote}

Our additional suggestion:
{quote}
Please also make sure to not include a leading or trailing whitespace (e.g. by copying and pasting your username.
{quote}
fields.summary: Password reset messages are misleading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As documented in [How to Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch on Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-833941594.html], _journal_ directory must be deleted before reindexing. This however may cause that node to run full site reindexing at every restart afterward if there is no new index journal (content updates that require an index update e.g. new page, page update, etc...) during that reindexing. The reason is Confluence expects there must always be some entries in [journal directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/deleting-the-journal-ids-on-nodes-will-cause-indexing-to-run-on-restart-945123939.html].
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Just follow the instructions described in [How to Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch on Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-833941594.html]

h3. Expected Results
{{<confluence-home>/journal/main_index}} is created when the index is rebuilt.

h3. Actual Results
{{<confluence-home>/journal/main_index}} is not created.

h3. Notes
When you do some page operation (e.g. new page, page update, etc...) after rebuilding index, you can see that the file is created for the first time.

h3. Workaround
When you do [How to Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch on Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-833941594.html], add a step to make page operation on Confluence as
{quote}
Start Node 1 *and make any page operation on Confluence (this will recreate journal/main_index directory)* . This node will rebuild its index from the database automatically on startup. Log files will print lines like the below to signify the reindex has been kicked off:
{quote}
fields.summary: Site reindex should reset journal entry pointer upon successful completion to prevent  the reindex run after each restart when the journal entry queue is empty

fields.description:
h4. Summary
 # Search does not find certain pages when the Indexing language is set to the default English and the page name contains a dot, ".".
 # Search works as expected when using Indexing language like "Other".

h4. Example and Steps to replicate
 # Create the following pages, and search using the following terms.
 # Found: (/) Not Found: (x)
 # *Search term:* "bj"
 ## *Page name:* bj (/)
 ## *Page name:* 1.bj (x)
 ## *Page name:* a.bj (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost.bj (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost1.bj (x)
 # *Search term:* "bx"
 ## *Page name:* bx (/)
 ## *Page name:* 1.bx (/)
 ## *Page name:* a.bx (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost.bx (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost1.bx (/)
 # *Search term:* "bl"
 ## *Page name:* bl (/)
 ## *Page name:* 1.bl (/)
 ## *Page name:* a.bl (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost.bl (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost1.bl (/)
 # *Search term:* "bm"
 ## *Page name:* bm (/)
 ## *Page name:* 1.bm (x)
 ## *Page name:* a.bm (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost.bm (x)
 ## *Page name:* localhost1.bm (x)
 # If we were were to switch the Indexing language to "other", the search for "bj" and "bm" returns the pages for the other pages as well.
 # If we were to use wildcard search, like below, all pages are returned, but this also depends on the name of the page before the dot. where pages like *serv0.bjl01*, will not return even with wilcard search is used.
 ## 
{noformat}
Search Term: /.*bj.*/     

// This returns all the *.bj pages{noformat}

 ## 
{noformat}
Search Term: /.*bjl01.*/

// This would return a page named "localhost.bjl01"
// But this would not return a page names "serv0.bjl01" (Unless we change the indexing language to "Other"{noformat}

h4. Current Behavior
 # Search does not work as expected for certain characters like "bj" and "bm",after a dot in the page name, when the indexing language is the defaut English.

h4. Expected behavior
 # Searching for these characters should return the pages as the search for the pages that work, like "bx" and "bl".

h4. Notes
 # Tested on Firefox, Chrome, IE
 # Tested by indexing from scratch and incognito/private browsing between test.
fields.summary: Search does not work as expected for some characters after with "." in the page name

fields.description:
h3. User Scenario:

Error while attempting to log in to Confluence iOS app post upgrade to version 1.2.0
*"Unauthorised error. Your session timed out. Log in again to keep working"*
h3. Expected Result :

Login successfully
h3. Actual Result:

Users end up with the above mentioned error
h3. Cause 

During the login process cookies sent from the server are stored in the "pre-authentication cookie store" but post login certain cookies are not transferred from the "pre-authentication cookie store" to the "post authenticated cookie store". The absence of these special cookies that are needed for authenticated calls is the reason for the app's session expiry.
h3. Workaround

As of today, developers have shipped a beta version, Confluence iOS app v1.3.0.142 to TestFlight, which can be downloaded using the link [https://testflight.apple.com/join/BP8yM5kF] 
h3. Note

This TestFlight build may not be released into production till the end of Jan next year as we are currently in a release freeze.
The issue seems to affect Crowd SSO users as well.
fields.summary: Confluence iOS App users unable to login after updating to version 1.2.0

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22nd July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We've discovered that this issue is a symptom of a bug at CONFSERVER-57582. Please watch that issue for further updates, and more detailed background and workarounds.
{panel}
h5. Bug Summary:

"Go to included page" option in Excerpt Include macro is not possible when page contains square brackets
h5. Environment:

Confluence 6.13.0, postgres9.5 google chrome
h5. Steps to replicate
 * Create page A which contains square brackets in the page  title for example: "Page with [square] brackets"
 * Create page B.
 * Add +Excerpt Include+ macro and point it to the page A
 * Save the Page B
 * Access edit mode for page "B"
 * Click on Excerpt macro and  then navigate to "Go to Included Page" button

h5. Expected results
 * Page A "Page with [square] brackets" will be opened

h5. Actual results

Following error is returned:
{panel}
HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request
 Type Exception Report

Message Invalid character found in the request target. The valid characters are defined in RFC 7230 and RFC 3986

Description The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Exception

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid character found in the request target. The valid characters are defined in RFC 7230 and RFC 3986
 org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseRequestLine(Http11InputBuffer.java:467)
 org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:294)
 org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:66)
 org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:770)
 org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1415)
 org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
 java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
 java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
 Note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the server logs.
{panel}
h3. Workaround
 # Go to <confluence_install>/conf, and edit the server.xml file.
 # Find all connectors your application is using. Just search for Connector in the file, or look at the example below. You're interested only in connectors whose protocol is set to HTTP and HTTPS (not AJP).
 # Add {{relaxedQueryChars="[,]"}} to the connector properties in server.xml. For example:
{code:java}
        <Connector port="26156" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                   maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                   enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" debug="0" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
                   relaxedQueryChars="[,]"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"/>
{code}

 # Restart Confluence
fields.summary: "Go to included page" option  in Excerpt Include macro is not possible when page contains square bracket

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On some Windows operating systems, after installing Atlassian Companion software, Companion can be used normally. Restart the system, Companion will not work properly, and the lower right tray has no Companion icon. The double-click desktop Companion shortcut can't be started either. It needs to be reinstalled before it can be used, and it needs to be reinstalled every time it restarts.

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Start a Windows system with Companion App previously installed
* If the issue happens, the Companion App will not be able to be launched properly, as described above
* The exact causes or circumstances that cause this to happen are not known, as it is an intermittent issue.

h3. Workarounds
Removing the previous Companion App directories and installing the application again makes it work correctly once more.
fields.summary: Atlassian Companion app can't work properly after restarting the system on some operating windows machines

h3. Problem
Email Notification when a user is mentioned can break when the page body contains some special characters

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Setup Confluence with SMTP Mail Server
# Create a Page using the Storage Format below:
 [^table storage format.txt] 
# Mention a user in the _Comments_ column

h3. Expected Result
Email notification received by the mentioned user should include the page body content normally

h3. Actual Result

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the [Code Block Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/code-block-macro-139390.html], should the sample code placed in the macro contain a URL, it will automatically become a clickable link once saved. This can be an issue when a placeholder URL, such as [https://example.com/], is being used, which will take users to a 404 page or an unwanted area.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to disable the automatic hyperlink that is created.
h3. Why this is important

Having active links in a code block appears to be extremely undesirable at many companies, especially when documenting any internal APIs, in which there can be a number of links that trigger actions such as tracking counts, trigger jobs, etc.
h3. Workaround

A current workaround would be to use the no format macro, which unfortunately loses syntax highlighting.

Upgrading to Confluence version 6.13.0 also prevents the automatic creation of links within the code block macro.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of automatic Hyperlinks in Code Block Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page has unpublished content, the Unpublished Changes lozenge appear at the top of the page. This is clickable, and it refreshes the page. This behavior appears in Firefox, Chrome and Safari. In IE, however, it redirects to the home page of the space. 

Ideally, Unpublished Changes lozenge should *not* be clickable as the current behavior causes confusion to users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page and add some content to it and then publish it. 
# Edit the newly saved page and then add some extra content, this time do not publish. Click on *close*
# The Unpublished Changes lozenge will appear on the top.
# Click on it.

h3. Expected Results
The Unpublished Changes lozenge should not be clickable, or if it is clickable, it should redirect to the edit mode.

h3. Actual Results
The page is refreshed in Firefox, Chrome and Safari. In IE, however, it redirects to the home page of the space. 
In Confluence 6.12 onwards, clicking on the "Unpublished Changes" rectangle sends the user to the _#all-updates_ dashboard, which is even worse from user experience point of view.

h3. Workaround
Confluence administrator may choose to change the behaviour of the lozenge, removing the link underneath it.
This can be accomplished with a [custom JavaScript|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-javascript-in-confluence-313458839.html].
When the bug is resolved, you may need to remove this customisation as a best practice.
# Go to *Cog Icon* > *General Configuration* > *Custom HTML*.
 #*  Or directly access {{<Confluence Base URL>/admin/viewcustomhtml.action}}
# Click on the _Edit_ button.
# In the _At end of the HEAD_ box, add the below JS.
{code}
<script type="text/javascript">
	AJS.toInit(function(){
	  AJS.$('#draft-status-lozenge').attr("href", "#");
	});
</script>
{code}
# Click on _Save_.
fields.summary: Clicking the Unpublished Changes lozenge refreshes the page.

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
Login as "User A"
1. Create a new space "Foo".
2. Create another space "Bar"
3. In the Foo space create a page "Foo".
4. In the Bar space create a page "Bar"
5. In both spaces create a page under the project page named "foobar" (same name in both spaces, different content)
Page from Foo
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
Page from Bar
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
6. Restrict the access to page "foobar" from Space 'Foo" to User A only.

Login as "User B"
7. Because of the page restriction, the "foobar" page from Space Foo  is not visible/accessible.
8. Open Bar page in space Bar.
9. Move Bar page (and sub page) to the space Foo.
10. Confluence moves the Bar page and the foobar child page and [fails to detect that there's already a foobar page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52564] in the Foo space.

Login as "User A"
11. The page tree of space Foo contains the page foobar twice (under "Bar" and "Foo"). Both foobar pages point to the same physical page. The other page is gone. (The page with content "From A and only A" is missing)


 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 


*Possible workaround for the missing page*

Move the page back to the original location, you should be able to see both page's original content.
Rename the page then only move to the desired location
fields.summary: Moving Restricted page pointed to wrong page if both page having the same title

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21/08/2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-32106 - Broken documentation links when upgrading using Installer|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32106]. This is a current and verified bug in Confluence, please watch that issue for further updates.

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the Confluence exe installer, there's a screen for *Upgrade Check List*, but the links are all broken:
 !snap002.png|thumbnail! 

Example: by clicking *back up* it leads you to this page:
https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/docs-6.13.0/Production+Backup+Strategy

Which should be now:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/production-backup-strategy-38797389.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Fix the links from our installers so that users are able to navigate to them.

h3. Note
My example is referring specifically to atlassian-confluence-6.13.0-x64.exe
fields.summary: Links from Upgrade Check List on Windows Installer broken

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Selecting a user's name in Stakeholder's section disappears if use TAB key to go to the next section in the *Decisions Template*
h4. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Create from template > Decision > Next
 # In the Stakeholders field, start typing the name of a user > Highlight user > hit TAB key. The user is not added to the Stakeholders field.
 # Enter the name in the field again, it will give 'No matches found'.
 # But the user's name is shown in Stakeholder after clicking on 'Create'.

h4. Expected Outcome

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h4. Actual Outcome

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
h4. Workaround
 * Using 'ENTER' key instead of 'TAB' key
 * The stakeholder's name still shows after clicking 'Create' button when using 'TAB' key

 h4. Notes
* This issue also happens when you select the stakeholder's name first and then proceed to select a due date. By clicking on the due date field, the stakeholder's name disappears.
* If you need to insert both the stakeholder's name and the due date, the recommended workaround would be to add first the due date and only then the stakeholder's name
fields.summary: Selecting Stakeholders on Decisions template using TAB

fields.description:
h4. Summary
# In the Administrating Companion App document, we have a section that explain how to disable the Companion App if an admin choose to, which is to disable the *Edit With button* module, in the *Confluence Previews* add-on.
# This works fine, and when clicking on the file when attached on the page itself, the file previews, and the "Edit with* button is no longer there as expected.
# But, if we were to click on the file from the page's Attachments page, the preview will not load.

h4. Steps to replicate
# Upload a simple PDF file onto a page.
# Disable the *Edit With button* module, in the *Confluence Previews* add-on.
# Click on the file on the page itself, and it should preview fine.
# Click on the file from the attachment page, the preview will not load.

h4. Current Behavior
# Preview on the attachments page does not work when *Edit With button* module is disabled in the *Confluence Previews* add-on.

h4. Expected behavior
# Preview should work on the attachments page does not work when *Edit With button* module is disabled in the *Confluence Previews* add-on.
fields.summary: Disabling "Edit With button" module prevents preview from working on the Attachments page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting to an ICS / iCal file, most event types (Leaves, Birthdays, etc) in Team Calendars concatenate the "Who" and "Summary" Team Calendar fields into the SUMMARY field in the ICS file. The "Events" event type only includes the "What" Team Calendar field and not the "Who" field in the ics SUMMARY field. The "Who" field is required in the event types which put it in the ICS SUMMARY field, but is not required in the "Events" type.
h3.  Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an event of the "Events" event type
 # Include text in the "What" field for the event and users for the "Who" field
 # Subscribe to the calendar in Google Calendar or iCal, or download the ICS file and inspect it in a text editor

h3. Expected Results

Event in the ICS export shows "*Who: What*" in the SUMMARY field or as the description in a calendaring application
h3. Actual Results

Event shows "*What*" in the SUMMARY field
fields.summary: "Events" type does not export Who field into ICS summary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In current versions of Confluence, users are unable to add Flickr URL links utilizing the *Widget Connector Macro*, which we [specifically mentioned|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/widget-connector-macro-171180449.html] should work with Flickr. When users add the Flickr URL with the macro, it does not render the content and instead displays a gear icon on the page.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 6.11.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit any page and add the *Widget Connector Macro*
# In the *Web Site's Widget URL* parameter, paste the URL provided by Flickr for sharing an image.

h3. Expected Results

When adding the Flickr URL through the macro, it should display the image on the page.

h3. Actual Results

hen users add the Flickr URL with the macro, it does not render the content and instead displays a gear icon on the page:

 !gear-icon.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

I was able to replicate the issue in Confluence 6.13, as well as trying different Flickr URLs, such as the direct Image URL itself with no luck.

h3. Workaround

The current workaround would be to get the Embed HTML code for an image provided by Flickr and embed it to a page using the [HTML Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html].
fields.summary: Widget Connector Macro no longer working with Flickr URLs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Uploading some PPTX files to Confluence can cause a high CPU/Memory usage which causes the instance to crash or become unavailable. Although this bug was fixed [CONFSERVER-52279|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52279], the Aspose Library for Powerpoint Slides being used doesn't implement an InterruptMonitor to stop that thread from leaking memory or CPU resources

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a large Powerpoint file
# Wait for the preview to generate
# At the same time monitor the CPU and memory usage on your instance

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should be able to handle the conversion of a PPTX file and if it reaches a certain threshold it should kills/quit the conversion.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence becomes unresponsive. High CPU/Memory usage starts showing and we see this in the thread dumps:
h5. Thread Dumps
In the thread dumps, you would see a *long running thread* that looks like this
{code}
"conversion-thread-2-internal" #108270 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f070068e000 nid=0x7227 runnable [0x00007f05cb539000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at sun.font.T2KFontScaler.getUnitsPerEMNative(Native Method)
	at sun.font.T2KFontScaler.getUnitsPerEm(T2KFontScaler.java:227)
	- locked <0x0000000662839a10> (a sun.font.T2KFontScaler)
	at sun.font.FileFont.getUnitsPerEm(FileFont.java:247)
	at sun.font.SunLayoutEngine.layout(SunLayoutEngine.java:161)
	at sun.font.GlyphLayout$EngineRecord.layout(GlyphLayout.java:685)
	at sun.font.GlyphLayout.layout(GlyphLayout.java:466)
	at java.awt.Font.layoutGlyphVector(Font.java:2637)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.j7.int.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.j7.int.while(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.j7.int.catch(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.j7.int. (Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.ek.public.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.ek.public.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.internal.dc.short.do(Unknown Source)
	- locked <0x00000007bc07ea70> (a java.lang.Object)
	at com.aspose.slides.cu.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0.if(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ah0. (Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.TextFrame.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.TextFrame.do(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.TextFrame.char(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.slides.ahw.do(Unknown Source)
...
{code}

h5. Heap Dumps
In the heap dump, you would see the following pattern
 !HeapLeakSuspect.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The current workaround is to upgrade to Confluence 6.10 or newer to benefit from the Sandbox feature for *Confluence Data Center*. You can read more about this in this documentation [Document Conversion Sandbox for Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf610/document-conversion-sandbox-for-confluence-data-center-952623449.html]

If you are running a server instance that is affected by the bug, you can disable the file conversions service as follows until it is possible to upgrade:

* [Disable the file conversions service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/file-conversion-service-causes-out-of-memory-errors-in-confluence-5-7-or-above-703398523.html#:~:text=Disable%20the%20file%20conversions%20service&text=To%20disable%20the%20file%20conversion%20service%3A,Conversions%20(file%2Dconversions)%20module]

h3. Mitigation Plan
If you are unable to upgrade to Confluence 6.10 and above and you would like to limit the impact of this issue on your instance, you can limit the number of conversion threads in your instance by adding the following JVM argument
{code}
-Dconfluence.document.conversion.threads=3
{code}
(!) *Please note that this JVM argument doesn't remove the risk of one thread causing this issue again, but it reduces the possibility of this issue having a bigger impact on your instance.*
fields.summary: PPTX File Conversion Service causes high CPU and/or memory usage because of Aspose Slides InterruptMonitor is not implemented

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The content API endpoint is available to retrieve content from a Confluence instance. While most users pass arguments that help to filter down to specific pieces of content, it is possible to hit the generic endpoint which fetches the entire contents of a given Confluence instance.  When this happens, the threads that are tasked to run the operation can run longer than expected, especially with larger Confluence instances. In addition, this is especially true for calls to this endpoint that are made anonymously (as the endpoint contains the @AnonymousAllowed designation) and a Confluence instance is not set up for anonymous access. When this occurs, the operation can still run for a longer than expected time and may ultimately return an empty set to the user. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Fill a Confluence with several hundred thousand ->  million pages
# run the following command *{{curl -X GET http://<baseURL>/rest/api/content | python -mjson.tool}}*

h3. Expected Results
# the operation will run and will not impact performance on the instance

h3. Actual Results
# the operation can be expensive and cause performance to degrade

h3.Workaround
Prevent calls to the base end point via networking/proxy rules
fields.summary: Hitting the base Content API endpoint can cause performance problem for large instances

fields.description:
h3. Use Case

If I'd like to host templates under a certain page for better tracking and to help my users to easily create them from just clicking a button anywhere, it should be allowed to change the creation link of the Create from Template macro.

h3. Situation

# I have a Space A and Page A to keep DACI templates
# Under Space A, I have thousand of pages, for my users to find where to create any DACI, currently, they need to navigate to Page A and create the template there.
# This proposal is to use the Excerpt on Page A, inside it have the Create from Template button for the DACI template.
# Now, on any of the thousand pages, I can simply add the Excerpt Include and add Page A with the Excerpt macro. Doing this, I have the create from template button and with just one click my users should be able to create the DACI template under Page A instead of needing to find the respective page.

h3. Current Situation
The create from template button is just a shortcut for a specific template so, it will create under the page you are currently in.

h3. Workaround
It might be possible to do this by [editing the macros|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/macro-editor/] in question.
fields.summary: Allow changing create from template macro creation link when using excerpt + include macros

fields.description:
h5. Bug Summary: 
xml backup zip file contains empty directory 

h5. Environment:
Confluence 6.13 Linux (64bit)

h5. Steps to replicate
* Retrieve latest daily  scheduled xml backup file or:
* Go to Confluence Administration -> backup & restore -> Bask up Confluence data. 
* Open created backup zip file with any file editor (for example vim)

h5. Expected results
Backup file contains files entities.xml, exportdescriptor.properties and directories: resources, plugin-data, attachments (if selected during backup creation process)

h5. Actual results
Backup file contains all files and directories listed above + one empty directory 

h5. Additional notes:
* Bug not reproducible with older versions than 6.13
* Backup file from 6.13 can be restored on other 6.13 instance without problems
fields.summary: Directory with empty name inside backup archive

fields.description:
At the moment, the author column in "Community Forums"  shows either
 * User Link (user ID with link to user)
 * Plain Text (user ID without link)
 * User Link/Picture (real user name with picture)

In our company, the user ID differs from the real user name as it's an anonymous number.
But in a forum, we like to show the real name of the topic author.

This would work with "User Link/Picture" - the real user name is shown - but the picture takes space and extends (doubles !) a topic line's height.

My suggestion is a fourth possibility in the "Forum - Topic Author Column" macro, that shows the real user name in the same way "User Link/Picture" but without the user's picture .
fields.summary: Community Forums: Topic Author Column macro : real username without picture

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary 
# In Jira, we can create custom fields for issues with different types, like "List", "Text Field", and "Label", each with their own format.
# In Confluence, with the *Jira Chart* macro, when using the *Two Dimensional* chart's *Display Option*, custom *Text Field* from Jira do not appear as selection for the *XAxis* and *YAxis*.
# Other custom fields with type "List" and type "Label" appear fine.
# There is a difference between the text and label however, where for the text custom fields, I could only filter them between null or not null, and could not use the equals sign *=* in my query, but I could do so with labels, querying the exact value like * = 2.4.3* for example.

h4. Expected behavior
# All custom fields should be able to appear in the Jira Charts macro

h4. Current Behavior 
# Custom field with type "Text Field" do not appear.

h4. Workaround
# Use type "Label" instead.
fields.summary: Custom Jira fields with type "Text Field" do not appear on Jira Charts macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'Find' option in Editor only finds first instance of text when using new version of Firefox browser.

h3. Environment
 - Firefox Quantum 63.0.3
 - Tested in Confluence 6.6.3, Confluence 6.6.9 and Confluence 6.12.1
 - Also tested in different OS (Mac OSX Mojave and CentOS 7)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, create a new page and insert multiple times the same word, for example: 'Content'.
 !01_create_page.png|thumbnail!
 # In Edit mode, hit ctrl+F, cmmd+F, or click the 'Find/Replace' icon on the top right corner.
 !02_find.png|thumbnail!
 # In the 'Find' box type the written word 'Content' (or whichever word used) and hit 'enter' or click 'Next'.
 !03_type_next.png|thumbnail!
 # After finding the first instance of the search, click 'Next' again.
 !04_next_again.png|thumbnail! 
 (!) Notice that nothing changes and it doesn't highlight the next word.

h3. Expected Results

It is expected to see the next instance of the word highlighted in the same way we see the first instance. 
 Exemplo screenshots taken from Google Chrome:
 # Type 'Content' in the 'Find' box and click 'Next'
 !01_from_chrome.png|thumbnail!
 # Click 'Next' highlight moves to next word
 !02_from_chrome.png|thumbnail!
 # Click 'Next' highlight moves to next word, so on and so on...
 !03_from_chrome.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

Only the first instance of the word is highlighted even after clicking 'Next'
h3. Workaround
 - Use older versions of Firefox, version 62.0.3 works fine
 - Use different browsers, tested with Safari and Google Chrome and it works fine.
fields.summary: 'Find' option in Editor only finds first instance of text when using new version of Firefox browser

fields.description:
I'm a Confluence Admin for my company and I have several "clients" who use the page properites macros to track weekly statuses in a desired format, then display just the status reports.

We would like an option to hide the page title from the page properties report macro. As of today, it's defaulted to always being first.

 

!https://chalk.charter.com/download/thumbnails/557321317/page%20properties%20current.JPG?version=2&modificationDate=1538765628000&api=v2|height=250! *displays the current settings*

fields.description:
The Confluence Server [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html] page states that Confluence can only be used with Oracle JRE/JDK or AdoptOpenJDK.  However, AdoptOpenJDK *is* OpenJDK...just a specific packaging of OpenJDK.

Requiring AdoptOpenJDK for the platform-native installers of Confluence Server might make sense from a packaging perspective.  However, for those of us using the "TAR.GZ Archive" distribution and configuring our own installation, why is AdoptOpenJDK required?

Will Confluence Server actually fail with OpenJDK packaged in other ways, e.g. the Fedora distribution package?  If so, what are the impacts and when will they be resolved?  And if not, is this simply a documentation error?

Note that the Jira Server [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] page states that OpenJDK is supported, and that testing has also occurred with AdoptOpenJDK.  Is this a more accurate phrasing of the Confluence Server requirement?
fields.summary: Confluence Supported Platforms states that AdoptOpenJDK is required

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence will send a different email notification for each page that the user watches.

As a Confluence administrator, I would like to be able to set *one email containing all changes* for the spaces/pages that the users watche. This could be set to send this email with all changes that happened in the last hour, for example.

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
[Gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Gadgets] were designed to allow you to display information dynamically from sources like iGoogle or Jira, for example, in Confluence. The first gadgets were introduced in Confluence 3.1, and much of the technology they were based on is now superseded or obsolete. Since then we have also implemented a number of better ways to display dynamic information using macros and other integration points.

We ended support for the following Gadgets in Confluence 7.0, and hid them from the macro browser. Any existing instances of these gadgets will still work, but you won't be able to insert these gadgets into the editor using the macro browser:

* Activity Stream
* Confluence Page Gadget
* Confluence Quick Nav Gadget

The News gadget was removed in Confluence 7.0 as it was not currently functional. 

End of support means Atlassian will not fix bugs related to these gadgets in Confluence 7.0 or later versions. We will remove these gadgets entirely in a future Confluence release, and will provide more information at that time.
{panel}

Feel free to comment on this issue if this change will have a significant impact on your Confluence site. 

Find out more about our other [planned changes in Confluence 7.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Planned+changes+in+Confluence+7.0]

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence currently provides the ability to watch a specific page or an entire Space. You can do that either via auto-watch or a manual watch.
At the moment, it is not possible to track whether an email notification was generated through Space or Page watch and whether this was triggered through auto-watch or a manual watch


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good if we are able to distinguish those scenarios which will allow the Confluence admin to determine where the bulk of the email notifications is coming from.
fields.summary: Ability to track a space or page email notification and whether it was triggered by auto-watch or manual watch

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As usage grows, Confluence can end up sending a lot more notifications than desired due to page or space level watches.

Currently, a Confluence/Space Administrator needs to manually remove watchers at the page and space level one-by-one via View Page > Manage Watchers. This can be cumbersome if there are a lot of pages and individual watchers. Additionally, there is no way to turn off notifications for a given space in general.

h3. Suggested Solution
The suggestion is to have the following capabilities in a configuration page:
# As an admin, disable watching an entire Space in bulk (for individual page watches, space watches, or both)
# Turn off email notifications (or, prevent watching) for a specific Space entirely
fields.summary: Disable Watch functionality per Space including email notifications of that Space

fields.description:
Currently, The Atlassian Companion only registers the first save operation in a desktop application, after which the file remains open and editable. Further saves are not registered, which can leave to data loss in cases where users are unaware of this flow.

fields.description:
Bug report

Summary

When a Confluence user creates birthday event setting 'END' to year 2090 for example.  Also, has recurring set to "Yearly", Reminder set for 5 minutes.

The above set up results in event not showing up in the UI but registered in DB (Tablename : AO950DC3_TC_EVENTS)

Every 5 minutes logs get spammed with below entries,

{code}
2018-10-23 04:40:00,166 ERROR [team-calendars-worker-2] [extra.calendar3.util.DefaultAsynchronousTaskExecutor] call Exception happens on task execution:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Range start must be before range end
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.DateRange.<init>(DateRange.java:71)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Period.<init>(Period.java:101)
{code}


h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create birthday event in Team Calendar
# Set the start date and end date (for example 3rd December 2018 - 3rd December 2090)
# Set the Recurrence as Yearly
# Set Reminder for 5 minutes
# Issue was reproducible in Team Calendar version 6.0.22, 6.0.25 and 6.0.27

h5. Expected Results
Event should not be created and an error message indicating end date is not valid

h5. Actual Results
UI doesn't display the event

h5. Workaround
Identify and delete the event from the DB. Following SQL query might help in identifying the large duration (range) values:
{code}
select "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS"."ID",  "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS"."ID",   "START", to_timestamp("START" / 1000) as START_DATE, "END", to_timestamp("END" / 1000) as END_DATE, DATE_PART('day', to_timestamp("END" / 1000) - to_timestamp("START" / 1000)) as EventDurationDays,  "RECURRENCE_RULE", "SUB_CALENDAR_ID", "UTC_START", "UTC_END"
FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS" inner join "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" on "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS"."SUB_CALENDAR_ID" = "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS"."ID"
where DATE_PART('day', to_timestamp("END" / 1000) - to_timestamp("START" / 1000)) > 50
{code}

Note:
This is affecting any events created and not just Birthday events.
fields.summary: Team Calendar issue while creating Any Events

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#B2D4FF | titleBGColor=#B2D4FF | bgColor=#EAF1FC}
Confluence provides a number of [integration points with Hipchat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Use+Hipchat+and+Confluence+together], including the ability to send page notifications to a Hipchat room, and use Hipchat emoji in Confluence pages. As you may be aware, we have discontinued development on all chat products. Hipchat Cloud services will be shut down in February 2019, and HipChat Data Center and Server will both reach end of life during the next 18 months.

We plan to take a phased approach in Confluence, so that any organizations still using Hipchat Server or Data Center can continue to use this integration.

We ended support for all bundled Hipchat plugins in Confluence 7.0. These are disabled by default for new installations. This will have no impact on existing installations, and can be easily enabled if required.

End of support means that Atlassian will not fix bugs related to Hipchat integration in Confluence 7.0 or later versions. 
{panel}

Feel free to comment on this issue if this change will have a significant impact on your Confluence site. 

Find out more about our other [planned changes in Confluence 7.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Planned+changes+in+Confluence+7.0]

If don't use Hipchat, or have migrated to Slack already, find out about [Disabling the HipChat Integration with the Atlassian products|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Disabling+the+HipChat+Integration+with+the+Atlassian+products] to reduce clutter in Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If Confluence uses Two Factor Authentication, the Companion App cannot edit/save Office files when using the *Edit With* functionality. The error below is thrown when trying to open an Office file with the Companion app: 
{quote}
Excel cannot open the file XXXXX.xlsx because the file format or file extension is not valid. Verify that the file has not been corrupted and that the file extension matches the format of the file. 
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.11.2
* Third party Two Factor Authentication 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the Atlassian Companion App
# Create a page
# Upload an Excel file (or any Office file) to the page
# Click on the file to show in Preview
# Click *Edit with Excel*

h3. Expected Results
The file opens in Excel and the user is able to edit the file and save it. 

h3. Actual Results
The Companion App tries to retrieve the attachment from the Confluence URL, but since the instance is behind 2FA, it cannot authenticate the request. 

The Excel file becomes corrupt, and its contents contain tagging from the 2FA application denying the Companion App access to the Trusted URL. 
 

h3. Workaround
For the time being, the only way to work around this error is to disable the Atlassian Companion App. This can be done manually, but it requires downgrading a plugin which may not be compatible with newer versions of Confluence and is not supported. However, this has been tested and it works with up to Confluence 6.12 so far:
 * Shutdown Confluence
 * Copy the *OfficeConnector-6.0.0.jar* from an older version of Confluence (i.e. 6.10)
 * Place it in the *confluence_install/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/* folder
 * From the same folder, move the *OfficeConnector-7.0.3.jar* to another folder as backup
 * [Clear the plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 * Restart Confluence

You can then [disable the Atlassian companion app|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-the-atlassian-companion-app-958456281.html#AdministeringtheAtlassianCompanionApp-Disablefileediting] functionality, and use 'Edit in office' moving forward. 
 (!) Note this is only recommended if there is an SSO issue or if there is something in your environment that blocks the use of the companion app. For companion app troubleshooting, please reference this guide: [Administering the Atlassian Companion App|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-the-atlassian-companion-app-958456281.html].
fields.summary: Edit in App does not work when Confluence is integrated transparent SSO (and 2FA)

fields.description:
h2. Current Situation

Confluence Team Calendars can send out reminders for events.  For some event types (Birthday, Travel, Leave), the 'Who' field from the event is included with the notification.  For other event types, including custom events, it is not.  

For Travel, Birthday, and Leave events, the reminder will say:
*<Username>'s travel*
For any other event, the reminder will just use the 'What' field from the event

 !reminders.jpg|thumbnail! 

h2. Suggestion

Make the calendar reminders customizable so that users or admins can choose which fields to include in the reminders.
fields.summary: Make Calendar Reminder Text Customizable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if a Confluence admin has Google Analytics set up on their instance, they will only track the usage of users who have come to the site via the website on desktop.

It does not track usage through the mobile app

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to include Google Analytics details in app for tracking usage.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to include Google Analytics details in mobile app to track usage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Given that an internal user is:
# Disabled. 
# Has been specifically added in the Individual Users section of a space's Space Permission. 
This user will still be visible in the list of Individual Users space permissions without any visual indication that it is disabled. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user that belongs to the Internal User Directory.
# Ensure the user is enabled.
# Head over to a space and then to Space Permissions.
# Under individual Users, add the above user and setup some permissions for that user. 
# Head over to *General Configuration* > *Users* and then disable the user. 
# Head over back to the above space permissions.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be shown as disabled or is not shown under the Individual Users.

h3. Actual Results
The user is displayed without any visual indication that it is disabled.
fields.summary: Disabled Internal Directory User appears in the Individual Users section of Space Permission without the disabled tag

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Multibyte characters don't get rendered when conversion sandbox enabled even when appropriate font is installed with the following steps.
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/non-ascii-characters-display-as-square-characters-in-confluence-317948797.html]
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Data Center
 * document.conversion.sandbox.disable=false (same as default)
 * Multibyte font installed on the server
 ** "4 fonts package" of Japanese IPA fonts ([https://ipafont.ipa.go.jp/old/ipafont/download.html#en]) installed in
 *** /usr/share/fonts
 *** /opt/atlassian/confluence/jre/lib/fonts/fallback
 ** Following JVM argument is specified in setenv.sh
{code:none}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dconfluence.document.conversion.fontpath=/usr/share/fonts/ -Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.regular=IPAGothic -Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.asian=IPAGothic -Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.symbol=IPAGothic ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dconfluence.document.conversion.words.defaultfontname=IPAGothic ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Japanese fonts on the hosting server as described in above.
 # Start a Confluence Data Center instance
 # Attach [^テスト.pptx] in an editor

h3. Expected Results

"テストプレゼンテーション" is shown in thumbnail and preview.
h3. Actual Results

Square characters are shown for thumbnail and preview.
 * Thumbnail
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-29 at 18.11.04.png|thumbnail!

 * Preview
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-29 at 18.11.21.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Characters are rendered correctly for some file type. 
 As far as I confirmed in 6.12.2,
||file type||thumbnail||preview||
|pptx|(x)|(x)|
|docx|(/)|(x)|
|xlsx|(/)|(/)|
|txt|(/)|(x)|
h3. Workaround

Disable the conversion sandbox adding following option in setenv.sh. This is not recommended as it will affect the stability of the instance.
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Ddocument.conversion.sandbox.disable=true ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}

h3. Solution

Add the following to setenv.sh so that system settings are correctly propagated to the sandbox:
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Dconversion.sandbox.java.options=-Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.regular=IPAGothic,-Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.asian=IPAGothic,-Dconfluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.symbol=IPAGothic,-Dconfluence.document.conversion.words.defaultfontname=IPAGothic  ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}
fields.summary: Multibyte characters don't get rendered when conversion sandbox enabled
